author: Sascha-69
body: # Comment Couldn't find any other hint, if there are any prerequisites to run PowerShell 7 and later on Windows Server 2016. Therefore I'm trying it here. # Steps to reproduce Open PowerShell 7 at Windows Server 2016 # Expected behavior Should start without throwing the exception. # Actual behavior Messagebox "pwsh has stopped working" Unhandled exception. System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLog' threw an exception. ---> System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLogProvider' threw an exception. ---> System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array. at System.Globalization.CultureData.GetNFIValues(NumberFormatInfo nfi) at System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo..ctor(CultureData cultureData) at System.Globalization.CultureInfo.get_NumberFormat() at System.Globalization.CultureInfo.GetFormat(Type formatType) at System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.get_CurrentInfo() at System.Guid.TryParseExactD(ReadOnlySpan\`1 guidString, GuidResult& result) at System.Guid.TryParseGuid(ReadOnlySpan\`1 guidString, GuidResult& result) at System.Guid..ctor(String g) at System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLogProvider..cctor() --- End of inner exception stack trace --- at System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLog..cctor() --- End of inner exception stack trace --- at System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLog.LogConsoleStartup() at Microsoft.PowerShell.UnmanagedPSEntry.Start(String consoleFilePath, String[] args, Int32 argc) at Microsoft.PowerShell.ManagedPSEntry.Main(String[] args) # Environment data $PSVersionTable can't be provided here, because PS7 is crashing before, but under PS 5.1 it looks like this: Name|Value ----|----- PSVersion|5.1.14393.3471 PSEdition|Desktop PSCompatibleVersion|{1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...} BuildVersion|10.0.14393.3471 CLRVersion|4.0.30319.42000 WSManStackVersion|3.0 PSRemotingProtocolVersion|2.3 SerializationVersion|1.1.0.1

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: What install package do you use?

comments.author: Sascha-69
comments.body:
I'm using the 2 MSI's
PowerShell-7.0.0-win-x64.msi
PowerShell-7.1.0-preview.2-win-x64.msi

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @Sascha-69 We need repo steps to investigate the error. Can you reproduce this on clean system?

comments.author: Sascha-69
comments.body: I have it on at least 3 different 2016 servers, but I'll try to install a clean system this afternoon.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: What is culture on your server?

comments.author: Sascha-69
comments.body:
Get-Culture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1053             sv-SE            Swedish (Sweden)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I see the stack trace `System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.get_CurrentInfo()` so I guess you change a number format on your system?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Can you share `[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo]::CurrentInfo`? (From Windows PowerShell)

And `[System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo]::CurrentInfo.NativeDigits`

comments.author: Sascha-69
comments.body:
was a bit a surprised, thought we were using English, but here are the requested details.
Thanks to spend your time on it.

CurrencyDecimalDigits    : 2
CurrencyDecimalSeparator : ,
IsReadOnly               : False
CurrencyGroupSizes       : {3}
NumberGroupSizes         : {3}
PercentGroupSizes        : {3}

PercentNegativePattern   : 0

comments.author: Sascha-69
comments.body: Even if I don't really get it, why this is disturbing PowerShell 7 to load , it is working when it is switched to English.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@Sascha-69 Thanks! Please share your OS version and confirm that you install latest updates.

I open new issue in .Net Runtime repo and you can monitor it status (perhaps they ask you to share more info)

comments.author: Sascha-69
comments.body: Thanks a lot, will provide the details in the new .Net Runtime rep thread.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@Sascha-69 .Net team ask to report the issue to Windows team using Windows 10 Feedback Hub. They think it is OS level issue. I think so too. I guess it is a localization bug.
If you have a support contract you could open a case and send Windows team traces and logs.

Thanks for your report!

/cc @SteveL-MSFT for information. (This case can come back to your team :-) )

title: PowerShell 7 and 7.1 on Windows Server 2016 cannot be opened
